title: 11 of the best music videos from lockdown
description: When lockdown thwarted musicians' plans to shoot music videos, they were forced to get creative.

title: Week in pictures: 1 August-7 August 2020
description: A selection of remarkable images taken around the world this week.

title: Beirut explosion: Families search for missing loved ones
description: Families in Beirut are still desperately seeking news of missing loved ones.

title: Sushant Singh Rajput: Mystery and voyeurism around Bollywood star's death
description: The investigation into Sushant Singh Rajput's death has taken several twists and turns.

title: Coronavirus in South Africa: Why the vuvuzelas fell silent
description: The country's fight against Covid-19 was initially celebrated, but the public mood has now soured.

title: Screen-time messages designed to decrease phone use
description: A new project encourages adults to communicate more with their kids and focus less on their devices.

title: The Greatest Showman: The story of Cardiff's giant
description: How a giant went from the slums to being the Queen's bodyguard and an American circus star.

title: Coronavirus severely restricts Antarctic science
description: Keeping Covid out of Antarctica means little research will be done on the continent in 2020-2021.

title: Eat out to help out: 'We've had 15,000 bookings'
description: Restaurants are cautiously optimistic after the first week of the government's discount scheme.

title: CEO Secrets: ‘What I learned from leaders’ behaviour off-camera’
description: A look at what business leaders' behaviour off-camera reveals about their real personalities.

title: 'I won a holiday but it turned out to be a big scam'
description: Sammie Richardson was nearly duped by a fake competition on Instagram but there are more scams out there.

title: Firefighters tackle wildfire on Chobham Common in Surrey
description: Aerial footage from the area shows the scale of the fire.

title: Coronavirus: London's commuter towns see sharp rise in benefit claims
description: The drop in office-based working has affected commuters in London's hospitality sector, experts say.

title: Why are migrants crossing the English Channel?
description: Rising numbers of migrants are trying to cross the English Channel in dinghies and other small boats.

title: Can a Eurovision-style song contest work in the US?
description: The American Song Contest is set to air in 2021, organisers have announced.

title: Coronavirus: What am I allowed to do in the hot weather this weekend?
description: Hot weather is expected across the UK this weekend, but how do you stay within the rules?

title: Weather: Sunny scenes as England sizzles in heatwave
description: Sun worshippers head to beaches and parks or cool down in fountains and open air pools.

title: Eric Joyce: Ex-Labour MP sentenced for child sex offence
description: Eric Joyce had a video clip on a device showing the "sexual abuse of young children", a court hears.

title: UK sizzles as temperatures expected to reach 36C
description: Beachgoers are urged to avoid busy beaches, as forecasters predict one of the UK's hottest days ever.

title: Keeley Bunker: Wesley Streete jailed for rape and murder
description: Keeley Bunker, who was celebrating her 20th birthday, "trusted" Wesley Streete to walk her home.

title: Mini house-buying boom leads to highest ever monthly price
description: The housing market is showing a 'surprising spike' as people return to buying property after the lockdown.

title: Cheeky boar leaves nudist grunting in laptop chase
description: Photos of a naked Berlin man chasing a wild boar to get his stolen laptop back go viral.

title: Virus cases 'may be levelling off' in England
description: After a low in cases at the end of June, the ONS estimated infections had been rising slightly in July.

title: Coronavirus: UK 'will not hesitate' to add nations to quarantine list
description: Chancellor warns there is "always the risk" holidays may be disrupted, as virus cases climb in France.

title: Stone pub landlord 'complacent' in enforcing Covid rules
description: The landlord of the Crown and Anchor says he "regrets" not taking a tougher stance with customers.

title: I'm A Celebrity will swap jungle for ruined British castle, ITV says
description: The reality show will swap the Australian jungle for a ruined British castle for this year's series.

title: Channel migrants: 235 people in 17 vessels stopped in one day
description: Among the 235 people who landed in Kent were children and a heavily pregnant woman.

title: Sturgeon criticises Aberdeen players after game is called off following positive tests
description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon is "pretty furious" with Aberdeen players after their match against St Johnstone is postponed because of positive Covid-19 cases.

title: Foreign Office cat Palmerston retires to countryside
description: The famous mouser will spend more time "away from the limelight", he "tells" officials in a letter.

title: Racing Point fined and docked points for illegal copying
description: The Racing Point team are docked 15 points and fined for illegally copying parts of last year's Mercedes Formula 1 car.

title: Beirut explosion: 'We don't have dreams any more'
description: The huge blast in Beirut's port can be seen as a tragic symbol of Lebanon's dysfunction as a state.

title: A DIY guide to perfect lockdown eyebrows
description: With eyebrow treatments still off the menu, Radio 1 Newsbeat asked a professional how it's done.

title: Lionel Messi and Barcelona: Is his time at Nou Camp coming to an end?
description: BBC Sport examines the relationship between Barcelona and Lionel Messi, who has put contract talks on hold, and is free to walk away from the Nou Camp at the end of the season.

title: Coronavirus: How to stay cool in a face mask as hot UK weather forecast
description: Temperatures are forecast to top 30C in some parts of the UK this weekend. Perhaps it is not the time you want to be partially covering your face.

title: Why Nadia Rose put her 'finger up' to music bosses
description: The rapper on controlling her own destiny, "outlandish" new music, and receiving texts from Rihanna.

title: World's remotest Irish bar: 'We will survive Covid'
description: It has been closed since April, you can’t reach it by car, and it's a two-day hike from the nearest airport.

title: How the pandemic is sending some Brazilians ‘two steps back’
description: Strides made to reduce poverty in Brazil are being reversed by the economic upheaval caused by Covid.

title: 'It took 32 years, but I finally found my kidnapped son'
description: After Li Jingzhi's son went missing in 1988 she dedicated her life to searching for him. He was found in May this year.

title: Beirut explosion: Before-and-after images
description: Satellite and aerial images show the extent of the Beirut port explosion that ripped through the Lebanese city.

title: Quiz of the week: What happened on FA Cup Final day?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?
